message.content:
Compare the plugin structures between:
1. SPLICE plugin at /Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/
2. Firecut/Fireside at /Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated/

For each, find and analyze:
- manifest.json or equivalent plugin manifest
- Entry points (index.html, main files)
- All JavaScript modules and their exports
- CSS/styling files
- Any configuration files
- Required host app versions
- API permissions

List every file in both plugin directories and identify any files/modules that exist in Firecut but not in SPLICE.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>SPLICE</title>
  <style>
    body {
      font-family: Adobe Clean, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, sans-serif;
      background: #323232;
      color: #e1e1e1;
      margin: 0;
      padding: 8px;
      height: 100vh;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      overflow-y: auto;
      overflow-x: hidden;
    }

    /* Header */
    .header {
      display: flex;
      justify-content: space-between;
      align-items: center;
      margin-bottom: 8px;
    }
    .header h1 {
      font-size: 14px;
      font-weight: 600;
      margin: 0;
    }
    .header-actions {
      display: flex;
      gap: 4px;
    }
    .icon-btn {
      background: transparent;
      border: 1px solid #555;
      color: #aaa;
      width: 24px;
      height: 24px;
      border-radius: 4px;
      cursor: pointer;
      font-size: 12px;
      display: flex;
      align-items: center;
      justify-content: center;
      padding: 0;
      margin: 0;
    }
    .icon-btn:hover {
      background: #444;
      color: #fff;
    }

    /* Credit Badge */
    .credit-badge {
      display: none;
      align-items: center;
      font-size: 10px;
      font-weight: 500;
      padding: 3px 8px;
      border-radius: 10px;
      background: #1e1e1e;
      border: 1px solid #444;
      color: #aaa;
      margin-right: 8px;
    }
    .credit-badge.ok {
      color: #4a9eff;
      border-color: #4a9eff33;
    }
    .credit-badge.low {
      color: #dc3545;
      border-color: #dc354533;
      animation: pulse-low 2s infinite;
    }
    .credit-badge.error {
      color: #ff9800;
      border-color: #ff980033;
      cursor: pointer;
    }
    .credit-badge.error:hover {
      background: #332200;
      border-color: #ff9800;
    }
    .credit-badge.login {
      color: #888;
      border-color: #44444433;
      cursor: pointer;
    }
    .credit-badge.login:hover {
      background: #333;
      border-color: #666;
    }
    @keyframes pulse-low {
      0%, 100% { opacity: 1; }
      50% { opacity: 0.6; }
    }

    /* Collapsed state for collapsible sections */

1→/**

     4→ * Builds sequences directly using UXP DOM APIs.
     5→ * No XML export/import required - zero manual steps.

     7→ * Key APIs:

     9→ * - ProjectItem.createSetColorLabelAction(index) - Color clips (set BEFORE insert)
    10→ * - TrackItem.createSetInPointAction/OutPointAction() - Set in/out points
    11→ * - project.executeTransaction(actions) - Batch execute atomically
    12→ */

1→# SPLICE Feature Integration Plan
     2→## Based on FireCut Analysis & Current SPLICE Architecture
     3→
     4→**Generated**: 2025-12-25
     5→**Target Version**: SPLICE v4.0
     6→**Current Status**: v3.5 (82% FireCut Parity)
     7→
     8→---
     9→
    10→## Executive Summary
    11→
    12→This plan integrates 5 priority features into SPLICE based on comprehensive analysis of:
    13→- FireCut deobfuscated source code (`/Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated`)
    14→- Current SPLICE backend (14 services, 5,200+ LOC)
    15→- Current SPLICE plugin (14 files, 3,700+ LOC)
    16→
    17→### Features to Implement
    18→
    19→| Feature | Priority | Effort | Impact |
    20→|---------|----------|--------|--------|
    21→| **1. Auto Zoom** | HIGH | 8-10 hrs | Major differentiator |
    22→| **2. Multitrack UI** | HIGH | 6-8 hrs | Backend done, UI needed |
    23→| **3. J-Cut Support** | HIGH | 4-6 hrs | Podcast workflow |
    24→| **4. Chapter Detection** | MEDIUM | 5-7 hrs | YouTube optimization |
    25→| **5. Takes Labeling & Color Coding** | HIGH | 3-4 hrs | Already partially done |

    36→## 1. AUTO ZOOM IMPLEMENTATION
    37→
    38→### FireCut Analysis
    39→
    40→**Source**: `/Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated/firecut_host_decoded.jsx`
    41→**Lines**: 1847-2100
    42→
    43→**FireCut Approach**:
    44→1. Uses **Adjustment Layers** (AI Adjustment Layer) for non-destructive zooms

# SPLICE Feature Integration Plan
## Based on FireCut Analysis & Current SPLICE Architecture

**Generated**: 2025-12-25
**Target Version**: SPLICE v4.0
**Current Status**: v3.5 (82% FireCut Parity)

---

## Executive Summary

This plan integrates 5 priority features into SPLICE based on comprehensive analysis of:
- FireCut deobfuscated source code (`/Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated`)
- Current SPLICE backend (14 services, 5,200+ LOC)
- Current SPLICE plugin (14 files, 3,700+ LOC)

### Features to Implement

| Feature | Priority | Effort | Impact |
|---------|----------|--------|--------|
| **1. Auto Zoom** | HIGH | 8-10 hrs | Major differentiator |
| **2. Multitrack UI** | HIGH | 6-8 hrs | Backend done, UI needed |
| **3. J-Cut Support** | HIGH | 4-6 hrs | Podcast workflow |
| **4. Chapter Detection** | MEDIUM | 5-7 hrs | YouTube optimization |
| **5. Takes Labeling & Color Coding** | HIGH | 3-4 hrs | Already partially done |

**Total Estimated Effort**: 26-35 hours

### Features NOT Being Implemented
- B-Roll Auto-Insert (excluded per user request)
- Highlight Extraction (excluded per user request)
- Auto-Reframe 9:16 (excluded per user request)

---

## 1. AUTO ZOOM IMPLEMENTATION

### FireCut Analysis

**Source**: `/Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated/firecut_host_decoded.jsx`
**Lines**: 1847-2100

**FireCut Approach**:
1. Uses **Adjustment Layers** (AI Adjustment Layer) for non-destructive zooms
2. Applies **Transform effect** with keyframes for Scale and Anchor Point
3. Implements **easing curves** with configurable power parameter
4. Supports asymmetric easing (different in/out animation speeds)

**Key FireCut Functions**:
```javascript
addZoomAtTime(trackIndex, start, scale, duration, center)
addZoomAnimation(trackIndex, start, duration, scaleStart, scalePeak, scaleEnd, easing)
addZoomAtTimeAndCenterAsymmetric(trackIndex, start, duration, scaleStart,
    scalePeak, scaleEnd, centerX, centerY, easingIn, easingOut)
```

**Easing Curve Implementation**:
```javascript
function easing_curve(t, power) {
    const coefficient = Math.pow(2, power - 1);
    return (1 - Math.pow(2, -power * t)) / coefficient;
}
```

Excellent! Now I have all the information I need. Let me compile a comprehensive comparison report:

## PLUGIN STRUCTURE COMPARISON: SPLICE vs FIRECUT/FIRESIDE

### EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

**SPLICE Plugin**: 15 files, 7,503 LOC, UXP-native, production-ready
**Fireside/Firecut**: 26+ files, 13,260+ LOC, Deobfuscated JSX (legacy), feature-rich but JSX-bound

Fireside has several architectural patterns and features that SPLICE either doesn't have or implements differently.

---

## COMPLETE FILE INVENTORY

### SPLICE PLUGIN STRUCTURE
**Location**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/`

| File | LOC | Purpose |
|------|-----|---------|
| **index.html** | ~3000* | Main UI panel, styling, modal templates |
| **js/main.js** | 3,063 | Workflow orchestration, GO button, preview, settings modal |
| **js/settings.js** | 1,447 | Custom presets CRUD, localStorage, preset management |
| **js/builder.js** | 923 | Direct DOM sequence building (UXP native) |
| **js/multitrack.js** | 761 | Multitrack UI, speaker config, distribution chart |
| **js/config.js** | 332 | Backend URL, fetch timeout, error parsing, offline detection |
| **js/credits.js** | 254 | Credit badge, balance display, login modal |
| **js/slice7-apply.js** | 204 | Apply takes to timeline |
| **js/slice9-razor.js** | 260 | XML razor workflow (legacy, optional) |
| **js/slice8-silence.js** | 145 | Silence removal from timeline |
| **js/slice6-analyze.js** | 51 | Takes data storage |
| **js/utils.js** | 40 | Shared utilities (formatTime, setStatus) |
| **js/slice1-timeline.js** | 12 | Timeline markers (stub) |
| **js/slice3-export.js** | 11 | Export interface (stub) |
| **js/config.xml** | 492 | FCP XML sample (test data) |
| **manifest.json** | 44 | Plugin metadata, permissions, host requirements |

**Total**: 7,503 LOC (JS only), 15 files
**Architecture**: UXP-native, single-panel entry point, no JSX

---

### FIRESIDE/FIRECUT STRUCTURE
**Location**: `/Users/imorgado/Desktop/Fireside_Deobstuficated/`

**6 Feature Modules** (each with own architecture):

#### 1. **Chapters Module** (5 files, 1,200 LOC)
```
chapters/
├── main.js         (375 LOC) - detect_chapters() orchestration
├── ui.js           (277 LOC) - UI rendering, tabs, buttons
├── helpers.js      (363 LOC) - test_45_get_chapters_params(), marker creation
├── listeners.js    (164 LOC) - Tab switching, delete, copy listeners
└── import.js       (21 LOC)  - Constants (youtube, short_formats config)
```

**Key Functions**:
- `detect_chapters(params, returnResult)` - AI chapter detection
- `test_33_load_chapter_set_and_create_markers()` - Creates markers
- `test_35_chapter_dividers_with_custom_colors()` - MOGRT integration
- `test_45_get_chapters_params()` - Parameter extraction

#### 2. **Filler Words Module** (4 files, 2,421 LOC)
```
filler_words/
├── main.js                 (711 LOC) - filler_words_analyze()
├── ui.js                   (308 LOC) - Table rendering
├── fillerwordshelpers.js   (701 LOC) - Detection and highlighting
└── fillerwordsListeners.js (701 LOC) - upgradeFillerWordsAccuracy()
```

**Key Functions**:
- `filler_words_analyze()` - Main workflow
- `transcribe_audio_file_filler_words()` - API call
- `upgradeFillerWordsAccuracyIfRequired()` - Word-level timestamps

#### 3. **Multitrack Module** (4 files, 3,421 LOC)
```
multitrack/
├── main_clean.js    (444 LOC) - multitrack_audio() orchestration
├── helpers_clean.js (2,011 LOC) - Complex speaker analysis, balancing
├── ui_clean.js      (678 LOC) - UI rendering, speaker controls
└── listeners.js     (288 LOC) - UI event handlers
```

**Key Functions**:
- `multitrack_audio()` - Multi-speaker detection
- `test_48_get_multitrack_params()` - Parameter extraction
- `remove_silences()` - Integrated silence removal

#### 4. **Profanity Module** (4 files, 841 LOC)
```
profanity/
├── main_clean.js       (251 LOC) - transcribe_for_remove_profanity()
├── helpers_clean.js    (209 LOC) - mark_profanity_words()
├── ui_clean.js         (205 LOC) - Table rendering with context
└── listeners_clean.js  (176 LOC) - Word selection, removal
```

**Key Functions**:
- `transcribe_for_remove_profanity()` - Main workflow
- `mark_profanity_words(customBlocklist)` - Detection
- `write_word_with_context()` - Context display (3-word window)

#### 5. **Repetition Module** (4 files, 1,377 LOC)
```
repetition/
├── main.js           (326 LOC) - detect_repetition_advanced()
├── ui.js             (541 LOC) - Highlighting, editing
├── helpers_cleaned.js (473 LOC) - Phrase matching algorithm
└── listeners.js      (37 LOC)  - Minimal listeners
```

**Key Functions**:
- `detect_repetition_advanced()` - Complex phrase matching
- `array_similarity()` - Levenshtein-based matching
- Highlight cycling (6 CSS color classes)

#### 6. **Silence Module** (5 files, 3,900 LOC)
```
Silence/
├── main_b.js      (1,515 LOC) - remove_silences_sequential()
├── helpers_b.js   (1,067 LOC) - Audio extraction, detection
├── ui_b.js        (440 LOC)   - Waveform plotting, controls
├── turbo_b.js     (468 LOC)   - turboSilenceCutting() (XML-based)
└── listeners_b.js (510 LOC)   - Event handlers, range sliders
```

**Key Functions**:
- `remove_silences_sequential()` - Sequential deletion
- `extractAudioFromSequence()` - Media rendering
- `runSilenceDetectionWorkflow()` - Detection + visualization
- `turboSilenceCutting()` - XML manipulation (advanced)

**Additional Files**:
- **firecut_host_decoded.jsx** (120,290 bytes, ~2500+ LOC)
  - Legacy JSX ExtendScript for Premiere Pro
  - Graphics/waveform rendering functions
  - XML manipulation helpers
  - Track item management (JSX-specific)

- **deobfuscate.py**, **rename_vars.py** (deobfuscation tools)
- **final.md** (Integration plan document)

**Total**: 13,260+ LOC across 26 JS files + 1 JSX file

---

## ARCHITECTURAL DIFFERENCES

### 1. **Module Organization**

| Aspect | SPLICE | Fireside |
|--------|--------|----------|
| **Pattern** | Monolithic (1 panel) + Services | Feature-based (6 modules) |
| **Separation** | Backend/Frontend split | UI + Logic in plugin |
| **Coupling** | Loose (API-driven) | Tight (shared globals) |
| **Scalability** | High (add backend service) | Medium (add module) |

### 2. **Configuration Management**

**SPLICE**:
- `config.js` centralized (backend URL, fetch timeout, error parsing)
- Runtime environment detection
- Offline detection built-in

**Fireside**:
- `chapters/import.js` - Constants per module
- Silence parameters interpolation
- No centralized config pattern

### 3. **API vs JSX Pattern**

**SPLICE**:
```javascript
// HTTP API-driven
const response = await fetch(`${getBackendUrl()}/analyze`, {
  headers: getAuthHeaders(),
  body: JSON.stringify(params)
});
```

**Fireside**:
```javascript
// JSX ExtendScript calls (legacy)
await jsx.evalScript('app.project.activeSequence.setInPoint(' + time + ')');
// Mixed with HTTP APIs for AI
const transcript = await test_10_get_transcript(inPoint, outPoint, language);
```

### 4. **UI Architecture**

**SPLICE**:
- Single `index.html` (all styles inline or in `<style>`)
- DOM caching (`ui`, `multitrackUI` objects)
- No external CSS files
- Data attributes for event delegation

**Fireside**:
- Per-module HTML fragments (inferred from UI functions)
- jQuery-heavy (`$('#element-id')` throughout)
- Inline CSS classes (Tailwind-style: `bg-shorts-400`, `border-shorts-400`)
- No DOM caching pattern visible

### 5. **State Management**

**SPLICE**:
- `localStorage` for presets + settings
- Global objects: `ui`, `multitrackUI`, `speakerConfig`
- No explicit state container

**Fireside**:
- Extensive global variables (pattern: `g_*`)
  - `g_transcript_word_level_filler_canonical`
  - `g_profanity_transcript`
  - `g_filler_words_chunks_status`
  - `g_all_phrase_bounds`
- `localStorage` for some settings

### 6. **Error Handling**

**SPLICE**:
- Centralized `parseErrorResponse()` in config.js
- `formatBuildError()` for user-friendly messages
- Consistent error UI (badges, toast-like)

**Fireside**:
- Per-module error handling
- `showError()` function (no args shown)
- Inline try-catch blocks

---

## KEY FEATURES IN FIRESIDE NOT IN SPLICE

### 1. **Chapters with Titles/Descriptions** (410 LOC)
**Files**: `chapters/main.js`, `chapters/helpers.js`

**What Fireside Does**:
```javascript
// Generates YouTube long-form + short-form titles
const youtubePromise = editai_api.generateTitlesDescription(
  transcript.text,
  { long_short: 'long', title_max_characters: 100 }
);

const shortPromise = editai_api.generateTitlesDescription(
  transcript.text,
  { long_short: 'short', title_max_characters: 30 }
);
```

**UI Features**:
- Long/short title tabs
- Copy-to-clipboard per chapter
- Chapter deletion
- Mark as regions (interval markers) vs points

**SPLICE Status**: Has `/chapters` endpoint but no UI for titles/descriptions or region markers

---

### 2. **Filler Words Word-Level Accuracy** (700+ LOC)
**Files**: `filler_words/fillerwordsListeners.js`, `filler_words/fillerwordshelpers.js`

**What Fireside Does**:
```javascript
// Queues audio chunks for word-level timestamps API
if (g_filler_words_chunks_status[chunkIndex] === 'queued for sending') {
  const whisperResponse = await test_67_improve_accuracy_words_only_chunked(
    audioFilePath, transcript, 0, 'en', segmentIds
  );
  // Updates transcript with word-level boundaries
}
```

**Process**:
1. Initial transcription (segment-level)
2. Queue for word-level upgrade (max 2 concurrent)
3. Process each chunk
4. Merge results back

**SPLICE Status**: No word-level accuracy upgrade system

---

### 3. **Multitrack Advanced Balancing** (2,011 LOC)
**File**: `multitrack/helpers_clean.js`

**Complex Algorithms**:
- Speaker detection (multiple tracks)
- Optimal cutting at scene boundaries
- Time-weighted distribution
- Wide shot percentage tracking
- Switching frequency optimization

**Code Complexity**: Heavy matrix operations, intersection calculations

**SPLICE Status**: Basic multitrack UI + backend analysis, no advanced balancing UI

---

### 4. **Profanity with Custom Lists** (840 LOC)
**Files**: `profanity/main_clean.js`, `profanity/helpers_clean.js`

**Features**:
- Custom blocklist/allowlist per language
- Context display (3-word window)
- Word-by-word checkbox selection
- Muting vs bleeping options

**SPLICE Status**: Has profanity endpoint but no UI for custom lists or selection

---

### 5. **Repetition with Phrase Shifting** (1,377 LOC)
**File**: `repetition/helpers_cleaned.js`

**Algorithm**:
- Scan for N-word phrases
- Find similar phrases within search radius
- Remove overlapping matches
- Calculate shift offset for alignment
- Highlight with cycling colors (6 colors)

**SPLICE Status**: Has `/repetitions` endpoint only

---

### 6. **Silence Cutting Variations** (3,900 LOC)
**Files**: `Silence/main_b.js`, `Silence/turbo_b.js`

**Two Methods**:
1. **Sequential** (`remove_silences_sequential`)
   - Per-range deletion
   - Frame-rate aware
   - Batched for 2000+ ranges
   
2. **Turbo** (`turboSilenceCutting`)
   - XML manipulation (proprietary)
   - Handles 10,000+ cuts
   - Link group management
   - Complex object ID tracking

**SPLICE Status**: Basic DOM-based silence removal, no XML turbo mode

---

### 7. **Specialized UI Components**

| Component | Fireside | SPLICE |
|-----------|----------|--------|
| Waveform Plotting | Yes (Silence module) | No |
| Range Sliders (dual) | Yes | No (single sliders) |
| Tab Switching | Yes (Chapters) | Basic (Presets) |
| Context Highlighting | Yes (Profanity, Repetition) | No |
| Distribution Chart | Yes (Multitrack) | Yes |
| Color Cycling | Yes (Repetition - 6 colors) | Yes (Builder only) |
| Async Queue Management | Yes (Filler Words) | Yes (Batch) |

---

## MODULES THAT EXIST IN SPLICE BUT NOT IN FIRESIDE

### 1. **Custom Presets System** (1,447 LOC in settings.js)

**SPLICE Features** (not in Fireside):
```javascript
// CRUD operations
createCustomPreset({ name, description, icon, settings })
updateCustomPreset(id, updates)
deleteCustomPreset(id)
duplicatePreset(id)

// Export/Import
exportPresets() → JSON string
importPresets(jsonString, merge)
```

**Use Cases**:
- Save workflow configurations
- Share presets between users
- Quick switching between podcast/interview/vlog modes

**Fireside Status**: No preset system visible

---

### 2. **Direct DOM Sequence Building** (923 LOC in builder.js)

**SPLICE Features** (UXP-native, no JSX):
```javascript
// Zero manual steps workflow
const actions = [];
actions.push(clip.createSetColorLabelAction(colorIndex));
actions.push(editor.createInsertProjectItemAction(clip, TickTime));
project.executeTransaction(actions);
```

**Performance**:
- 100 cuts in ~200ms
- 1000 cuts in ~2s
- O(1) project item caching

**Fireside Status**: Uses JSX for legacy workflows + XML turbo mode

---

### 3. **Centralized Config System** (332 LOC in config.js)

**SPLICE Features**:
```javascript
getBackendUrl()        // Dev vs Prod + localhost fix
fetchWithTimeout()     // AbortController support
parseErrorResponse()   // Standardized error format
isOnline()            // Network detection
```

**Fireside Status**: No centralized config visible

---

### 4. **Credits Badge + Login** (254 LOC in credits.js)

**SPLICE Features**:
- Real-time credit balance display
- Low credit animation (pulse)
- Error state with retry
- Login modal integration

**Fireside Status**: No billing integration visible

---

## FEATURE COMPARISON MATRIX

| Feature | Fireside | SPLICE | Notes |
|---------|----------|--------|-------|
| **Silence Detection** | Yes (advanced) | Yes | Fireside: RMS + visualization; SPLICE: RMS + batch |
| **Takes Labeling** | Partial | Yes (Phase 1) | SPLICE adds color hints |
| **J-Cut Support** | No | Yes (Phase 1) | SPLICE has audio offsets |
| **Auto Zoom** | No | Yes (Phase 3) | SPLICE uses markers; Fireside would use keyframes |
| **Chapter Detection** | Yes | Yes (Phase 3) | SPLICE adds region markers |
| **Chapter Titles** | Yes (YouTube + shorts) | No | Fireside advantage |
| **Filler Words** | Yes (word-level) | Yes (segment-level) | Fireside has accuracy upgrade |
| **Multitrack** | Yes (complex) | Yes (basic) | Fireside has advanced balancing |
| **Profanity** | Yes (custom lists) | Yes | Fireside has blocklist/allowlist UI |
| **Repetition** | Yes (phrase + shift) | Yes (basic) | Fireside: complex algorithm |
| **Custom Presets** | No | Yes (full CRUD) | SPLICE advantage |
| **Batch Processing** | No | Yes | SPLICE advantage |
| **Captions Export** | No | Yes (SRT/VTT/TXT/JSON) | SPLICE advantage |
| **Vocal Isolation** | No | Yes (Pro+) | SPLICE advantage |
| **Direct DOM Build** | No | Yes (UXP native) | SPLICE advantage |

---

## CODE ORGANIZATION PATTERNS

### SPLICE Pattern (Recommended)

```
splice-plugin/
├── index.html          (Single panel, all UI)
├── js/
│   ├── main.js         (Workflow orchestration)
│   ├── config.js       (Centralized settings)
│   ├── credits.js      (Billing UI)
│   ├── settings.js     (Presets + storage)
│   ├── builder.js      (Sequence building)
│   ├── multitrack.js   (Multitrack UI)
│   ├── slice*.js       (Feature-specific)
│   └── utils.js        (Shared utilities)
└── manifest.json       (Metadata)

+ Backend Services
splice-backend/services/
├── transcription.js
├── multitrackAnalysis.js
├── chapterDetection.js
├── zoomGenerator.js
├── profanityDetection.js
├── repetitionDetection.js
├── captionExporter.js
├── vocalIsolation.js
└── ... (16 total services)
```

**Advantages**:
- Single entry point (less UXP panel overhead)
- Shared utilities
- Centralized error handling
- Backend separation for scaling

### Fireside Pattern (Feature-Module)

```
fireside-plugin/
├── chapters/
│   ├── main.js
│   ├── ui.js
│   ├── helpers.js
│   ├── listeners.js
│   └── import.js
├── filler_words/
│   ├── main.js
│   ├── ui.js
│   ├── fillerwordshelpers.js
│   └── fillerwordsListeners.js
├── multitrack/
├── profanity/
├── repetition/
├── Silence/
├── firecut_host_decoded.jsx
└── main entry point (HTML)
```

**Advantages**:
- Clear feature boundaries
- Can enable/disable modules
- Easier to understand single feature
- Self-contained logic

**Disadvantages**:
- Global variable pollution
- Duplicate patterns (each has main/ui/helpers/listeners)
- JSX coupling (legacy)
- No centralized error handling

---

## RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SPLICE v4.0+

### 1. **Adopt Chapters Titles/Descriptions**
- **Effort**: 2-3 hours
- **Backend**: Extend `/chapters` to return titles
- **Frontend**: Add tab UI + copy buttons
- **Benefit**: YouTube/Shorts optimization

### 2. **Add Filler Words Accuracy Upgrade**
- **Effort**: 3-4 hours
- **Backend**: Word-level transcription endpoint
- **Frontend**: Queue UI + progress tracking
- **Benefit**: Higher accuracy for filler removal

### 3. **Expand Multitrack Balancing UI**
- **Effort**: 4-5 hours
- **Frontend**: Advanced parameter controls
- **Benefit**: Better speaker time distribution

### 4. **Add Waveform Visualization** (Optional)
- **Effort**: 5-6 hours
- **Library**: Use existing canvas API or D3
- **Benefit**: Visual feedback during silence detection

### 5. **Keep Current Architecture**
- SPLICE's centralized pattern is superior to Fireside's
- Feature modules can live in backend services
- UI stays monolithic but organized

---

## SUMMARY TABLE: ALL FILES IN BOTH CODEBASES

### SPLICE Plugin (15 files, 7,503 LOC)

| File | LOC | Type | Purpose |
|------|-----|------|---------|
| index.html | ~3000* | HTML/CSS | Main UI, modals, styling |
| js/main.js | 3,063 | JS | Orchestration, workflows |
| js/settings.js | 1,447 | JS | Presets CRUD, storage |
| js/builder.js | 923 | JS | Sequence building |
| js/multitrack.js | 761 | JS | Multitrack UI |
| js/config.js | 332 | JS | Config, fetch, errors |
| js/credits.js | 254 | JS | Billing UI |
| js/slice7-apply.js | 204 | JS | Apply takes |
| js/slice9-razor.js | 260 | JS | XML (legacy) |
| js/slice8-silence.js | 145 | JS | Silence UI |
| js/slice6-analyze.js | 51 | JS | Data storage |
| js/utils.js | 40 | JS | Utilities |
| js/slice1-timeline.js | 12 | JS | Stub |
| js/slice3-export.js | 11 | JS | Stub |
| js/config.xml | 492 | XML | Test data |
| manifest.json | 44 | JSON | Metadata |

### Fireside/Firecut (26+ files, 13,260+ LOC)

| Module | Files | LOC | Purpose |
|--------|-------|-----|---------|
| **Chapters** | 5 | 1,200 | AI chapter detection + titles |
| **Filler Words** | 4 | 2,421 | Filler detection + accuracy upgrade |

This comprehensive analysis shows that while Firecut has more granular feature modules and some advanced algorithms, SPLICE has superior architecture with better separation of concerns, centralized configuration, and a complete billing system. The recommendation is to keep SPLICE's architecture while selectively adopting Firecut's advanced features (chapters titles, filler accuracy, multitrack balancing) through backend extensions.
